intro: Fimbristylis diphylla f. royeniana, commonly known as the royal sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers, which are usually greenish or brownish in color. Fimbristylis diphylla f. royeniana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
